formattedAddress: 200 Vesey St, New York, NY 10281, USA
adrFormatAddress: 200 Vesey St, New York, NY 10281, USA

editorialSummary.text: Stylish Italian restaurant with a bar, private dining, and event space.

originalText.text: Would not recommend to a newbie in Italian cuisine because of the strong taste. However everything is accurately described and the service is impeccable. Atmosphere is extremely romantic and elegant.

text.text: Would not recommend to a newbie in Italian cuisine because of the strong taste. However everything is accurately described and the service is impeccable. Atmosphere is extremely romantic and elegant.

originalText.text:
Went here for my birthday, was a coincidence that I was seated at the table that I seem to always sit when I celebrate my birthday.

Staff are excellent, service is excellent, food is excellent. Everything that can be expected of a place such as this and more. The General Manager, George, is a nice individual, and overall the atmosphere of the restaurant was very welcoming.

originalText.text: Beautiful inteior but way to expensive for average food. The pastas are excellent but everything else is mediocre. I dont recommend the veal especially for $60! The cocltails are excellent

text.text: Beautiful inteior but way to expensive for average food. The pastas are excellent but everything else is mediocre. I dont recommend the veal especially for $60! The cocltails are excellent

originalText.text:
This was our second visit to Sant Ambroeus (the first visit was to the Lafayette St location). Having loved that restaurant, we came in with high expectations. Although a lot of things were good, it just wasn't the same.

Most of the food was great - really liked the Spicy Rigatoni, Rigatoni Pesto, and the Salmon. The Cacio Pepe (we had loved it in the other location) just tasted bad and somewhat stale, but thankfully the server offered to change it right away with any other pasta of our choice. That gesture was much appreciated.

I asked for Minestrone soup that never arrived, and my request for hot water (which I asked for twice) was also ignored. Several dishes we wanted to order were not available (at least 3 dishes including both the desserts on the restaurant week menu were sold out).

Overall, for the price of the meal, I'd have expected a more consistent experience. Nonetheless, I hope someone from the restaurant reads this and fixes these issues (there are all solvable)

originalText.text:
I had high expectations for this restaurant. Although I’ve heard mixed reviews online, me and my husband decided to try it. We came in earlier than our reservation but we got seated right away. Started with bread and it was good. We ordered frito misto for appetizers and honestly it was mediocre. For $36 I was expecting it to be atleast good and appealing to the eye. It looked like those fried oreos they sell near the beach boardwalk. Then I had spaghetti al pomodoro for my main and to be honest, it was the worst pasta I’ve ever tried in all of new york. The sauce was bland, the pasta itself was harder than al dente, I only took 3 small bites and decided to not eat it. It was a disappointment. My husband had fettuccine alla bolognese which was okay I guess but not phenomenal. We've had better ones in other restaurants in the city. We had roasted potatoes and roasted brussel sprouts on the side and honestly, the only thing I enjoyed was the brussel sprouts. Lastly we had the princess cake.. which everyone was talking about but to my disappointment was plain sponge cake with some whipped cream and a hint of almond marzipan. We tried the Gianduia cake which was good. But overall, with more than $200 spent, I’d rather spend that money somewhere else. For that amount of food and the cost that we have to pay, theres so much better affordable Italian restaurants that serve waaaaayyyy better quality taste than what we just had. Such a shame cos the place was quite nice.

Only took one pic cos after the appetizer, I was just pissed to eat $36 appetizer that didn’t even taste appetizing.
